Package wes.apache.camel.orchestator.sdk.utils

Class ExchangeUtils

java.lang.Object
wes.apache.camel.orchestator.sdk.utils.ExchangeUtils
public class ExchangeUtils
extends java.lang.Object
Utility class for working with Apache Camel Exchanges. The ExchangeUtils class contains methods that deal with the Apache Camel Exchange object and provides functionality for working with it. This class is designed to simplify access to and manipulation of the Exchange object in a more efficient way.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Andrea-Cavallo

      public <T> java.util.Optional<T> getProperty​(org.apache.camel.Exchange exchange, java.lang.String key, java.lang.Class<T> type)
      Gets a property from the Exchange object based on the specified key and type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the class
      Parameters:
      exchange - the Exchange object to retrieve the property from
      key - the property key
      type - the expected type of the property
      Returns:
      the property value, or null if not found or the value is not of the expected type

    • checkPredicate

      public boolean checkPredicate​(org.apache.camel.Exchange exchange, java.lang.String name)
      Checks if the predicate associated with the given name in the Exchange evaluates to true.
      Parameters:
      exchange - the Exchange object to retrieve the predicate from
      name - the name of the predicate to check
      Returns:
      true if the predicate evaluates to true, false otherwise

    • setSerializedBody

      public void setSerializedBody​(org.apache.camel.Exchange exchange, java.lang.Object object)
      Serializes the given object into JSON and sets it as the body of the input message in the exchange. This method may throw an unchecked exception if the object cannot be serialized.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The exchange whose input message's body will be set to the serialized form of the object.
      object - The object to be serialized and set as the body of the input message in the exchange. UncheckedIOException If the object cannot be serialized to JSON. This is a runtime exception.
      See Also:
      ObjectMapper.writeValueAsString(Object)
